ul.li1: 221 A reputationLiterally “name” is to be chosen rather thanLiterally “from” great riches;
ul.li2: favor is better than silver and gold.Literally “from silver and from gold, favor is better”
ul.li1: 2Rich and poor have much in common;
ul.li2: Yahweh is the maker of all of them.
ul.li1: 3The clever sees danger and hides,
ul.li2: but the simple go on and suffer.
ul.li1: 4The reward of humility is the fear of Yahweh—
ul.li2: wealth and honor and life.
ul.li1: 5Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse;
ul.li2: he who guards himselfOr “soul,” or “life” will keep away from them.
ul.li1: 6Train the child concerning his way;Literally “on the mouth of his way”
ul.li2: even when he is old, he will not stray from it.
ul.li1: 7The rich will rule over the poor,
ul.li2: and the borrower is a slave of the lender.Literally “the borrower belonging to a man”
ul.li1: 8He who sows injustice will reap calamity,
ul.li2: and the rod of his anger will fail.
ul.li1: 9He who is generousLiterally “the generous of eye” will be blessed,
ul.li2: for he gives to the poor from his own bread.
ul.li1: 10Drive out a scoffer and strife will go out;
ul.li2: quarrel and abuse will cease.
ul.li1: 11He who loves purity of heart
ul.li2: and hasgracious speech,Literally “grace of his lips” his friend is the king.
ul.li1: 12The eyes of Yahweh keep watch over knowledge,
ul.li2: but he will overthrow the words of the faithless.
ul.li1: 13A lazy person says “A lion in the street!
ul.li2: In the middle of the highway, I shall be killed!”
ul.li1: 14A deep pit is the mouth of an adulteress,Literally “a strange woman”
ul.li2: he with whom Yahweh is angry will fall there.
ul.li1: 15Folly is bound up in the heartOr “mind” of a boy;Or “young man,” or “adolescent”
ul.li2: the rod of discipline will drive itThat is, folly from him.
ul.li1: 16He who oppresses the poor in order to enrich himself,
ul.li2: or gives to the rich, will come to poverty.Literally “only loss”

ul.li1: 17Incline your ear and hear the words of the wise;
ul.li2: you shall apply your heartOr “mind” to my teaching.
ul.li1: 18For it is pleasant if you guard them within you;Literally “in your belly/womb”
ul.li2: together they will be ready upon your lips.
ul.li1: 19In order for your trust to be in Yahweh,
ul.li2: I have made them known to you todayLiterally “the day”—evenOr “only” you.
ul.li1: 20Have I not written for you thirty sayings
ul.li2: with admonitions and knowledge?
ul.li1: 21In order to show you what is right—sayings of truth—
ul.li2: in order to return a true saying to him who sent you.
ul.li1: 22Do not rob the poor because he is poor,
ul.li2: and do not crush the afflicted at the gate;
ul.li1: 23For Yahweh will plead their case
ul.li2: and despoil those who despoil them of life.Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li1: 24Do not befriend an ownerOr “master” of anger,Literally “nostril”
ul.li2: and with a man of wrath you shall not associate;
ul.li1: 25lest you learn his way
ul.li2: and become entangled in a snare to yourself.Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li1: 26Do not be with those who give a pledgeLiterally “strike a hand”
ul.li2: by becomingLiterally “in the becomings of” surety.
ul.li1: 27If there is nothing for you to pay,Or “complete”
ul.li2: why will he take your bed from under you?
ul.li1: 28Do not remove an ancient boundary marker
ul.li2: which your ancestorsOr “fathers” made.
ul.li1: 29A man who is skillful in his work, you shall see:
ul.li2: before kings, he will serve;
he will not serve before the commoners.
